```{r}
library(LearnNonparam)

set.seed(2023)
```

# Chapter 1

## Example 1.1.2

```{r}
# See ?Quantile or ?onesample.quantile
t <- pmt(
    "onesample.quantile", alternative = "greater",
    prob = 0.5, null_value = 75,
    type = "approx", correct = FALSE
)

# See ?Table1.1.1
t$test(Table1.1.1)

t$statistic
t$p_value
t$ci
```

## Example 1.2.1

```{r}
# See ?CDF or ?onesample.cdf
t <- pmt("onesample.cdf")

# See ?Table1.2.1
t$test(Table1.2.1)

t$plot(style = "ggplot2")
```

## Example 1.2.4

```{r}
# See ?Quantile or ?onesample.quantile
t <- pmt(
    "onesample.quantile",
    p = 0.25, null_value = 0, conf_level = 0.90
)

# See ?Table1.2.1
t$test(Table1.2.1)

t$ci
```

# Chapter 2

## Table 2.1.1

```{r}
# See ?Difference or ?twosample.difference
t <- pmt(
    "twosample.difference", alternative = "greater", method = "mean"
)

# See ?Table2.1.1
t$test(Table2.1.1)

t$statistic
t$p_value
```

## Table 2.1.1 - wilcoxon

```{r}
# See ?Wilcoxon or ?twosample.wilcoxon
t <- pmt(
    "twosample.wilcoxon", alternative = "greater"
)

# See ?Table2.1.1
t$test(Table2.1.1)

t$statistic
t$p_value
```

## Example 2.3.1

```{r}
# See ?Difference or ?twosample.difference
t <- pmt(
    "twosample.difference", alternative = "greater", method = "mean"
)

# See ?Table2.3.1
t$test(Table2.3.1)

t$statistic

# all permutaions
t$p_value

# 1000 permutaions
t$n_permu <- 1000
t$p_value

# install.packages("microbenchmark")
microbenchmark::microbenchmark(
    use_all = {t$n_permu <- 0},
    use_1000 = {t$n_permu <- 1000}
)
```


# Chapter 3

## Example 3.1.1

```{r}
# See ?ANOVA or ?ksample.anova
t <- pmt(
    "ksample.anova", type = "approx"
)

# See ?Table3.1.2
t$test(Table3.1.2)

t$statistic
t$p_value

t$type <- "permu"

t$statistic
t$p_value
```

## Example 3.2.1

```{r}
# See ?KruskalWallis or ?ksample.kw
t <- pmt(
    "ksample.kw", type = "approx"
)

# See ?Table3.2.2
t$test(Table3.2.2)

t$statistic
t$p_value
```

## Example 3.2.2 & 3.2.3

```{r}
# See ?KruskalWallis or ?ksample.kw
t <- pmt(
    "ksample.kw", n_permu = 4000
)

# See ?Table3.2.3
t$test(Table3.2.3)

t$statistic
t$p_value


t$type <- "approx"
t$p_value


t$scoring <- "expon"

t$n_permu <- 4000
t$type <- "permu"
t$p_value

t$type <- "approx"
t$p_value
```

## Example 3.3.1

```{r}
# See ?MultiCompT or ?multicomp.t
t <- pmt(
    "multicomp.t", n_permu = 5000
)

# See ?Table3.3.1
t$test(Table3.3.1)

t$print()

t$type <- "approx"
t$print()

t$scoring <- "rank"
t$print()
```

```{r}
# See ?TukeyHSD or ?multicomp.tukey
t <- pmt(
    "multicomp.tukey", n_permu = 5000
)

t$test(Table3.3.1)

t$print()

t$type <- "approx"
t$print()

t$scoring <- "rank"
t$print()
```

## Example 3.4.1

```{r}
# See ?JonckheereTerpstra or ?ksample.jt

)

# See ?Table3.4.1
t$test(Table3.4.1)

t$statistic
t$p_value

t$p_value
```

# Chapter 4

## Table 4.1.1

```{r}
# See ?SignedDiff or ?paired.signeddiff
t <- pmt(
    "paired.signeddiff", alternative = "greater",
    scoring = "none"
)

# See ?Table4.1.1
t$test(Table4.1.1)

t$statistic
t$p_value
```

## Example 4.1.1

```{r}
# See ?SignedDiff or ?paired.signeddiff
t <- pmt(
    "paired.signeddiff", alternative = "two_sided",
    scoring = "none", method = "ignore"
)

# See ?Table4.1.3
t$test(Table4.1.3)

t$statistic
t$p_value

t$n_permu <- 4000
t$p_value

t$type <- "approx"
t$p_value
```

## Example 4.2.1 & 4.2.2

```{r}
# See ?SignedDiff or ?paired.signeddiff
t <- pmt(
    "paired.signeddiff", alternative = "greater",
    scoring = "rank", method = "with_zeros"
)

# See ?Table4.1.1
t$test(Table4.1.1)

t$statistic
t$p_value

t$type <- "approx"
t$p_value
```

## Table 4.2.3

```{r}
# See ?SignedDiff or ?paired.signeddiff
t <- pmt(
    "paired.signeddiff", alternative = "greater",
    scoring = "rank", method = "ignore"
)

t$test(data.frame(
    diff = c(-5, -3, -3, 0, 0, 2, 4, 4, 4, 5),
    zero = 0
))

t$statistic
t$p_value
```

## Example 4.3.1

```{r}
# See ?Sign or ?paired.sign
t <- pmt(
    "paired.sign", alternative = "greater", type = "exact"
)

t$test(data.frame(
    diff = c(rep(+1, 12), rep(-1, 5)),
    zero = 0
))

t$statistic
t$p_value

t$type <- "approx"
t$p_value
```
